result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Isaiah N Buford

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Isaiah N Buford appeared by video.  Attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke appeared by video for Isaiah N Buford.  Prosecuting attorney Alexandria S. Carlson in court for the State of Wisconsin. Status conference held. Defense is requesting a plea hearing. All conditions of bail remain. Case is adjourned in Branch 36.
Plea hearing scheduled for November 17, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Isaiah N Buford in court.  Attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke in court for Isaiah N Buford.  Prosecuting attorney Grace M. Gall in court for the State of Wisconsin. Scheduling conference held. Defense is pursuing a global offer. All conditions of bail remain as previously ordered. Case is adjourned in Branch 36.
Status conference scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Isaiah N Buford in court with Attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke; both appear by video.  Gregg Herman appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 38, Judge Wagner. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant.  Imposed and stayed bench warrant is withdrawn.
*All parties are notified that effective July 30, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge Laura A. Crivello, Branch 36,  in Room 316 Safety Bldg.  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 2, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and filed. Justice Point Supervision Report. Deputy Court Clerk: LVD

Attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke in court by video.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. The defendant does not appear due to difficulties with Zoom. Court will impose, but stay a bench warrant until the next date and ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 25, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Isaiah N Buford in court, appear by video with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke appear in person.  Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for a preliminary hearing. Attorney Lamke needs more time to meet with client.
 Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 23, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Caliber Collision at 2300 West Florist Avenue. Glendale, WI.; Jeremiah L.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.

Defendant Isaiah N Buford in court with attorney Christopher John Ertl.  Defendant Isaiah N Buford in custody.  Stephan Eduard Nolten appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Isaiah N Buford appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 16, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
